meanings.definition: Extending far down from the top or surface.
meanings.sent1: The hole got deeper as I dug into the ground.
meanings.sent2: The well is so deep that you can't see the bottom.
meanings.sent3: I tried to reach the bottom of the pool, but it just kept getting deeper.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a deep sadness that no one could reach.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the cave seemed to grow deeper with each step.

meanings.definition: Extending far from side to side.
meanings.sent1: The river became deeper as we moved away from the shore.
meanings.sent2: The canyon was so deep that it cast a shadow across the valley.
meanings.sent3: The pizza had a deep layer of cheese that stretched from edge to edge.
meanings.sent4: The forest was so dense, it felt like walking through a deep sea of trees.
meanings.sent5: The color of the sky turned a deep red as the sun set.

meanings.definition: Extending far back from the front.
meanings.sent1: The cave grew deeper as we ventured further inside.
meanings.sent2: The closet was so deep that you could hide all your secrets in it.
meanings.sent3: The bookshelf had a deep shelf that could hold many books.
meanings.sent4: The hallway seemed to stretch deeper into the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The mystery of the old house only grew deeper as we explored.
